intro: Tylophora longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-stemmed tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that release small, winged seeds upon maturity. Tylophora longipedunculata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
